page.title: 16Churches
page.content: { Shelton church}was built by{Sir {Ralph Shelton,}however, the tower is {Norman}and is square in shape. Gargoyles decorate the exterior of the church and tower. Inside, the church has many architectual features, one of which is the stained glass window which portrays the builder of the church.{The saint of this church is {Saint Mary. Morningthorpe church has {a round Saxon tower. The interior of the church has a medieval font and there is also a small carved figure of John the Baptist on a pew who is the patron saint of the church.{Fritton church {has a round tower which is mainly {Norman.}The church inside has two main features, one is the rood screen which is still fully usable and there are also two wall paintings of Saint George and Saint Christopher.
